p: Both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria can produce biofilms. Among the most important bacteria capable of biofilm formation, we can note Gram-positive bacteria such as Enterococcus faecalis, Staphylococcus aureus, Staphylococcus epidermidis and Streptococcus viridans and Gram-negative bacteria such as Escherichia coli, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Proteus mirabilis and Pseudomonas aeruginosa (Ulloa-Urizar et al., 2015 â–¶).
